RETURN_TO_SSS: Yes
SPILL_LOC_DESC: The spill location was from a private clean out in a parkinglot.
APPEAR_PT_EXPLAIN: The spill appearance point was from a private clean out in a private parkinglot.
FINAL_SPILL_DEST_EXPL: Once the spill surfaced on the asphalt of the private parking lot it ran down the concrete apron to a private storm drain approximately 15 feet away.  The spill then flowed through approximately 1500 feet of private storm drain.  The final destination was approximately 300 feet downstream of the discharge point of the private storm drain system into the City of San Marcos storm drain culvet.
SPILL_CAUSE_EXPLAIN: The plumber was unable to give a clear definition of the spill cause.
WHERE_FAIL_OCCUR_EXP: Vallecitos Water District is not responible for any part of the customers lateral.
RESPONSE_ACTIVITIES: Cleaned-up (mitigated effects of spill);Contained all or portion of spill;Returned all or portion of spill to sanitary sewer system
RESPONSE_ACTIVITIES_EXPL: When Vallecitos Water District personnel arrived on site, Vallecitos Water Districts sewer main near the affected business was checked for signs of surcharging.  Once inspection was completed, the system was found in normal working order with no signs of surcharging present.  Under the direction from the City of San Marcos additional personnel were called out to help run equipment needed to capture and clean up the spill site area.  A representative from the City of San Marcos said they would take responsible for making the notification to the of the spill incident to the appropriate agencies.  During that time the owner of the property was contacted and advised that a plumber needed to be contacted to remedy the spilling lateral.  Until a plumber had cleared the blockage, Vallecitos Water District personnel staged a vacuum truck at the private storm drain inlet.  The truck collected the sewer as it ran down the concrete apron stopping it before entering the private storm drain.  An additional vactor was placed at the effluent of the private storm drain dumping into the City of San Marcos storm drain.  Once the plumber had cleared the blockage and the lateral was flowing normally, Vallecitos Water District Personnel cleaned up the effects from the spill in the parking lot, concrete apron, private storm drain, and 300 feet downstream of the effluent discharge from the private storm drain and vacuumed the remaining sewer overflow up.

RETURN_TO_SSS: Yes
SPILL_LOC_DESC: The spill location was in the middle of a condominium complex consisting of paved walk ways and driveways.
APPEAR_PT_EXPLAIN: The spill appearance point was a private manhole located in the middle of the condominium complex.
FINAL_SPILL_DEST_EXPL: A storm drain inlet was approximately 5 feet southwest of the spilling manhole which was connected to a drainage channel located west of the property. Crews were able to contain the spill to the drainage channel, capture and return all flow to the sewer system.
SSO_PLSD_SOURCE_PLSD: High Density Residential (5 or more units - Apartments, Condos, etc.)
RESPONSE_ACTIVITIES_EXPL: Padre Dam was notified at 8:18 pm by Crystal Palmer, a representative of 360 Community Management regarding a manhole in their complex that was over flowing. Derek Campbell contacted supervisor John DeDonato at 8:20 pm and then responded to the call arriving on scene at 8:25 pm to find a private manhole locate in the complex of the Caspi Gardens Condominium complex. He contacted crew member Ruben Vizcarra to respond with a Vactor truck to assist with spill. John D. arrived 8:58 pm and Ruben at 9:05 pm, the Vactor truck was placed at the spilling manhole and removed the water from the manhole and main to stop the spill.  The spill was stopped at 9:19 pm. Padre Dam crews remained at the manhole monitoring levels to insure the spill would not start again. At 9:55 pm the plumber still hadnt arrive so the blockage was removed by Padre Dam staff so we could assist the City of Santee with the cleanup. The cleanup effort started approximately 9:25 pm. All affected areas in the complex were cleaned and disinfected by Padre Dam staff and they also assisted with the cleanup of the drainage channel. All wash down water in the complex and the drainage channel was captured and returned to the system.

RETURN_TO_SSS: Not Applicable - Spill did not reach a separate storm drainpipe
SPILL_LOC_DESC: The spill location was at the rear of the restaurant from the grease trap. Water spilled from the grease trap onto a concrete containment area and then to an asphalt driveway.
APPEAR_PT_EXPLAIN: Water spilled from the lid of  the grease trap.
WHERE_FAIL_OCCUR_EXP: Blockage occurred in the drain line from the grease trap to the lateral.
RESPONSE_ACTIVITIES: Cleaned-Up;Contained all or portion of spill;Other (specify below);Returned All Spill to Sanitary Sewer System;Other Enforcement Agency Notified
RESPONSE_ACTIVITIES_EXPL: At 12:20pm John DeDonato received a call from Pierre Aoun about a sewer blockage at his restaurant. He said he instructed his staff to stop using any water until the blockage had been removed. John dispatched a Vactor crew at 12:21pm and they arrived on scene at 12:39pm. Padre Dam has a small lift station on the property so staff checked for a system failure but the level in the wet well was 1.66 feet and everything checked out. Crews went to the back of the restaurant for calculation measurements and to assist with cleanup. Mr. Aoun was told he needed to contact a plumber to have the lateral cleared because the lift station was working fine and the levels were below the pumping levels. Mr. Aoun contacted Russell's Plumbing they responded and removed the blockage at 1:40pm.

A supervisor responded and arrived on scene at 6:59pm and the duty person at 7:00pm to find a cleanout belonging to the Islamic Center of Lakeside spilling sewage at a volume of about 3gpm. The spill was contained to the backyard of 10319 lozita Wy. and the spill was stopped at 8:09pm. Ali Alaiwi was told he need to have a plumber clear the blockage and the center was responsible for the cleanup of the spill.

RETURN_TO_SSS: Yes
SPILL_LOC_DESC: North side of the Wal-Mart building
APPEAR_PT: Lateral Clean Out (Private);Manhole;Other sewer system structure
FINAL_SPILL_DEST: Drainage Channel;Paved Surface;Separate Storm Drain;Street/Curb and Gutter
FINAL_SPILL_DEST_EXPL: Manhole for grease trap over flowed into the parking lot, followed the curb and gutter to the storm drain box.
SSO_PLSD_SOURCE_EXPLAIN: Wal-Mart with a McDonalds in location
RESPONSE_ACTIVITIES: Contained all or portion of spill;Property Owner Notified;Other Enforcement Agency Notified
RESPONSE_ACTIVITIES_EXPL: Padre Dams customer service department was contacted at 4:20pm by a member of Wal-Mart regarding water leaking from a storm drain cover, customer service referred them to the City of Santee for assistance. At 4:45pm the County of San Diego received a call for the same issue they dispatched an operator to assess the problem. S.D. County Waste Water Supervisor contacted Padre Dam After Hours person at 5:26pm to inform him of the issue. Wal-Mart has a manhole structure labeled as Storm Drain instead of sewer and thats where the confusion came in with customer service. The Padre Dam After Hours person arrived on scene at 5:54pm along with the Waste Water Supervisor at 5:57pm, at 6:06pm sand bags were placed at the curb to contain flow from reaching the storm drain. Wal-Mart management was told the cleanup responsibility was theirs. The City of Santee was contacted at 6:07pm to inform them of the storm drain intrusion and Wal-Mart staff contacted their remediation company for the cleanup. The cleanup was performed by N.R.C. Environmental cleanup began at 8:25pm and was completed at 11:10pm. Victor Murillo the project manager for N.R.C was contacted on 4/27/2015 regarding the details for the cleanup, they cleaned and disinfected the parking lot and storm drain and recovered 90% of the water. The spill was estimated at 6.9 gallons spilled 90%= 6.2 gallons recovered. Mr. Murillo felt confidant with the disinfecting of the storm drain the any contaminates in the water would have been eliminated.

SPILL_LOC_DESC: This private lateral spill occurred in the paved parking lot of the El Pollo Loco restaurant.
RESPONSE_ACTIVITIES: Other (specify below)
RESPONSE_ACTIVITIES_EXPL: This spill occurred on July 24, 2015 and all spill response was handled by the City of Santee, the city employees were unaware that any release from a private lateral was considered a sewer spill and did not notify Padre Dam. The city employees ruled this as a grease and oil spill and reported it to OES as such, Padre found out about it through a general conversation at a utility coordination meeting with the City of Santee. As far as the response from the city, the call came into the fire department at 4:00 pm, fire crews responded to the location to find the discharge had entered the storm drain located on the property, dirt from the area was used to attempt to contain the spill and sectioned off the parking lot to traffic. Cleaning crews were contacted by the restaurant manager and clean up started at 9:45 pm on 7/24 and completed on 8/7/2015 at 3:30 pm by Downstream Services. Spill estimation by the city was reported to OES 50 gallons, Padre Dam's automated water meter registered 269.28 gallons had passed through the meter from the time the spill started until the time it stopped. Both the city and Padre Dam agree 50% was consumed by the restaurant for food prep and soda consumption so the spill is being reported as 135 gallons.

RESPONSE_ACTIVITIES: Cleaned-Up;Property Owner Notified;Other Enforcement Agency Notified
RESPONSE_ACTIVITIES_EXPL: Amended Volume. The three buildings for this complex are on master meters and are auto read, the water usage for the times of this spill have been captured and determined to be a more accurate form of measurement then the previous method of spill estimating with a spill gauge.

RETURN_TO_SSS: No
SPILL_LOC_DESC: This spill occurred in a paved parking lot from a private cleanout, the spill flowed to the north end of the lot and into a drain located in a flower bed.
FINAL_SPILL_DEST_EXPL: The final spill location for this spill is unknown; The City of Santee inspected their storm drain system and found no evidence of the spill. It is unknown if the drain system for the complex is connected to the private sewer system.
SSO_PLSD_SOURCE_PLSD: High Density Residential (5 or more units - Apartments, Condos, etc.)
RESPONSE_ACTIVITIES_EXPL: After Padre Dam was contacted a supervisor and a 2 man crew responded with a flushing truck. Residents were contacted to remove vehicles located in the parking lot to contain the spill and assist with the cleanup. After the vehicles were removed the decision was made to remove the water from the lateral to stop the spill and clear the main of water to give the crew time to flush the main to try to remove the blockage. The main was flushed and then crews put water down the lateral to find the blockage had not been removed, by this time the plumber that had been contacted had arrived and it was determined the blockage was in the lateral and need to be removed by the plumber. The cleanup of the parking lot was performed by Padre Dam staff

RESPONSE_ACTIVITIES_EXPL: Padre Dam received a call from the resident regarding a blockage in their lateral, when Padre Dam staff arrived they found the home owner had opened the cleanout to release the water from the line. Sand bags were placed in the gutter to contain the water, the customer said he would do the cleanup and was instructed to use a water and bleach solution to disinfect the area, sand bags were left in place for containment during the cleanup. SPILL_LOC_DESC: This spill took place inside the house located at 9605 Hartland Circle.
APPEAR_PT_EXPLAIN: The appearance point was in the bath tub of the main bathroom of the house and also in the shower stall and on the bathroom floor located in the master bedroom.
RESPONSE_ACTIVITIES: Cleaned-Up;Mitigated Effects of Spill
RESPONSE_ACTIVITIES_EXPL: Padre Dam crews flushed the main to eliminate any potential blockages and inspected for possible damage that could have caused the spill. Originally this spill was thought to be an SSO and submitted the report to CIWQS on 5/11/16 Event ID 824485 but on 5/13/16 the customers lateral backed up a second time and at that time it was determined to be a lateral issue. The customer was instructed to contact a plumber to have the blockage removed and have the lateral inspected for damage. On 5/17/16 Gil Vazquez of the Calif. Water Board was contacted regarding the incorrect reporting of the SSO and agreed to cancel EID 824485 and resubmit as a PLSD. CIWQS report for the second occurrence is Event ID 824976

RESPONSE_ACTIVITIES_EXPL: Padre Dam supervisors and a flushing crew were dispatched to find the main in good working order, and it was determined that the problem was in the lateral and not the main as reported in Event ID 824485. The customer was advised to contact a plumber to remove the blockage from the lateral and inspect for damage. EID 82485 was canceled by Gil Vazquez with the Calif. State Water Board and a new PLSD report was filed on 6/1/16 EID 824974 for the first spill.

SPILL_CAUSE_EXPLAIN: PRIVATE - A FITTING FAILED ON THE CIRCULATION PUMP (pH TREATMENT/HOLDING TANK) THE LAST LOGGED VOLUME & pH VALUE WAS 2900 GALLONS; 7.4 pH OF WASHROOM WASTEWATER. SECONDAYR CONTAINMENT LEAKED & 1400 GALLONS OF pH ADJUST WASTEWATER IS ASSUMED TO HAVE ENTERED THE STORM WATER SYSTEM.  THE TREATMENT SYSTEM WAS IN A STANDBY MODE & NO WASTEWATER ENTERED THE SANITARY SEWER.

RESPONSE_ACTIVITIES: Other (specify below)

AN AUTO DIALER IS BEING SPECIFIED TO ALERT PERSONNEL OF LIQUID PRESENT IN SECONDARY CONTAINMENT & ADDITIONAL ALARMS FOR PUMP PRESSURE/FLOW.

SPILL_LOC_DESC: The spill occurred at a cleanout at the address listed.
FINAL_SPILL_DEST_EXPL: The storm drain had tarps, pigtails, and sandbags placed prior to the spill to protect from any sewer water from entering.
SPILL_CAUSE_EXPLAIN: The oncall operator responded to a slow drain lateral called in by the plumber at 480 S. El Camino Real.  Operator arrived onsite at 5:37 PM and determined the problem was in the private lateral and not the Leucadia Wastewater District sewer main.  Plumber proceeded to clean the private lateral.  At 6:30 PM, the oncall operator noticed sewer water coming out from the cleanout - plumber told immediately to stop work.  The oncall operator proceeded to recover and clean the private lateral spill.  The spill was contained by 6:45 PM and the the cleanup was completed at 7:30 PM.
SSO_PLSD_SOURCE_PLSD: High Density Residential (5 or more units - Apartments, Condos, etc.)
SSO_PLSD_SOURCE_EXPLAIN: The sewer spill came from a private lateral cleanout due to root intrusion downstream of the cleanout.
WHERE_FAIL_OCCUR_EXP: According to the plumber, roots downstream from the cleanout were the cause of the private lateral spill at the cleanout.
RESPONSE_ACTIVITIES: Cleaned-Up;Contained all or portion of spill;Returned All Spill to Sanitary Sewer System;Property Owner Notified
RESPONSE_ACTIVITIES_EXPL: Once the oncall operator noticed the spill occurring at the private lateral cleanout, he immediately protected and covered the storm drain downstream.  No sewer water entered the storm drain.  The oncall operator proceeded to vacuum the sewer water and then washed down the path of the sewer water from the cleanout.

SPILL_LOC_DESC: Private lateral spill occurred in the backyard at a private sewer clean out from the property at 7331 Bolero Street, Encinitas, CA 92024
FINAL_SPILL_DEST_EXPL: Homeowner has a giant backyard where spill occurred.  The spill was self contained.
SPILL_CAUSE_EXPLAIN: Homeowner, David Dixon, at 7331 Bolero St. notified the Leucadia Wastewater District (LWD) of wet ground in the backyard that smelled like sewer at 11:38 am.  LWD staff arrived at 12:00 pm noon to investigate and noticed a spill at the private sewer clean out on the property.  Upon further investigation by conducting a dye test to confirm whether the clean out belonged to the property, roughly 2 -3 gallons of water spilled during the dye test.  The dye test did confirm the clean out belonged to the homeowner at the address though.
RESPONSE_ACTIVITIES: Cleaned-Up;Contained all or portion of spill;Property Owner Notified
RESPONSE_ACTIVITIES_EXPL: Spill was self-contained because it was minimal.  Homeowner was on site with LWD staff and was advised to not use/shut off water until problem resolved.  LWD staff notified on 5/2/2016 problem was a result of root intrusion entering the top of the clean out, but the problem was resolved.  Homeowner had plumber clean, cctv sewer lateral to confirm no other issues.  Plumber disinfected area and used buckets/trashbags to recover spill.  Contaminated dirt was removed also.

RETURN_TO_SSS: Not Applicable - Spill did not reach a separate storm drainpipe

SPILL_LOC_DESC: Spill came out of a private cleanout in the back of 1190 Encinitas Blvd.
APPEAR_PT_EXPLAIN: Sewer spilled from a private cleanout in a 144 unit apartment complex. Upon arrival the oncall operator proceeded to vacuumed the sewer coming out of the private cleanout. He informed the property manager to get a plumber on site to clear the stoppage and to shut down water to all apartment units and buildings. Water to the apartments was not completely off until 2110.
FINAL_SPILL_DEST_EXPL: The sewer spill that was not recover dried up in the pavement, curb and gutter.
SPILL_CAUSE_EXPLAIN: Roots were present in the cleanout when on call operator open the clean out cap to capture spill
